item.title: European Central Bank likely to put rate cuts on pause amid trade uncertainty
item.description: Inflation at the ECB’s 2% target encourages a wait-and-see approach.

item.title: ‘His income is limited’: Should I pay $800 a month towards my husband’s $67,000 student debt?
item.description: “I have stopped short of paying for his business, his car payment and health insurance.”

item.title: Drinking alcohol more than three times a week can put your finances at risk
item.description: Alcohol can quietly undermine financial control, decision-making and long-term security.

item.title: GE Vernova says tariff impact will be less than thought, and the stock soars toward two records
item.description: GE Vernova’s stock was heading for a record high after an earnings beat, a raised full-year outlook and a lowered estimate of tariff impact.

item.title: Home prices hit an all-time high even as the housing market slowdown deepens
item.description: The housing market saw a deeper slowdown in June, as sales of existing homes dropped.
